definition: cards in one's hand/(fig.) undisclosed strength or information/hidden trump
(equivalent to 的 as possessive particle)
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base
mahjong tile/playing card/game pieces/signboard/plate/tablet/medal/CL:片[pian4],個|个[ge4],塊|块[kuai4]
to show one's hand/to lay one's cards on the table

sentences.english: Could blow those held-back cards onto our table.
sentences.chinese: 就能把生活的底牌吹到地面上。

sentences.english: It is not even clear if U.S. officials actually know what WikiLeaks has.
sentences.chinese: 沒有跡象表明美國官方真正掌握知曉維基解密的底牌。

sentences.english: Wang reveals the cards in his hands unconsciously.
sentences.chinese: 王主任無意間透露了底牌。

sentences.english: You can open cards yourself. With magic glasses, you can see through cards.
sentences.chinese: 你可自行開牌，也可運用魔術眼鏡透視底牌。

sentences.english: The bill is deemed crucial for U.S. credibility in Copenhagen.
sentences.chinese: 這份法案被認爲是美國在哥本哈根會議上的重要底牌。

inside information/the ins and outs of the matter/how things stand/what's up

unique skill/unexpected tricky move (as a last resort)/masterstroke/finishing blow
to be afraid of the consequences/restraining fear
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
stake (in a gamble)/(what is at) stake
to fold (poker)
to show one's hand/to lay one's cards on the table
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
trump card
game of chance/gambling party/gambling joint
